title: Deutsche Bank and Commerzbank Shares Tumble After Investor Dumps Major Stakes
sub_head: Contrarian investors had loaded up on German banks betting that the country’s lending landscape would change
body:
A large investor simultaneously sold major stakes in Deutsche Bank AG and Commerzbank AG , Germany’s biggest lenders, causing shares in both to tumble.
The undisclosed shareholder unloaded roughly 5% stakes in both banks, generating proceeds of around €1.75 billion, equivalent to $1.9 billion, based on the sale prices of the offerings, which were arranged by Morgan Stanley . The shares were offered at around 7% discounts to their previous trading levels.
